history.content: <md>It's really unfortunate that this is the case for international students, but really, it's not entirely the university's fault that the system is set up in this way. The requirements given by the government for CPT is that any employment must either count towards a degree requirement (which is currently not the case for CS/EECS) or count towards academic units. This means that, in order to work over summer, you must enroll in at least a one unit class through Berkeley, which fulfills the second condition. I don't know how likely it would be for the university to waive the fee of what is, in their eyes, a summer course, since I believe you have to submit a write-up of some sort at the end of CPT.  </md>

children.subject: <md>You can try to ask them to defer the units until the regular semester. I know you can do that with teaching units but not too sure if that is possible for CS197 as well.</md>
I don't care about submitting a writeup but I'm just not able to afford this cost.

Anon. Comp's answer is correct. I already asked about deferring the one unit to the fall and was told it couldn't be done. But I do think that you should get together as a group and see whether you can do something about this, especially since the cost has grown so much. Summer sessions used to be so much cheaper than it is now. We are working on reducing this requirement to one-half unit, but that will still be a lot.
<md>From my understanding, BIO requires that you be enrolled in a 97/197/99/199 course for CPT approval, and it can't be replaced with a different course. </md>
If we are already taking another CS class over the summer, do we still have to take CS197?

<md>The university is not entirely at fault, but it is far from innocent.

Correct me if I am wrong (as I have never enrolled in 197), but I think the university barely need to spend money on or literally do anything for students in CS 197, while they do need to put in funds for more TAs/readers if more students sign up for, say, CS 70. Why does one unit of 197 cost the same as one unit of 70?

I understand that the system is implemented from the governmental side but there are numerous ways for the university to alleviate the pain. Even if it is not possible to reduce the requirement to 0.5 unit (which cuts the cost by half), why can't the university just set a different price for summer 97/197/99/199? Or perhaps reduce students' out-of-pocket amount in the form of subsidy or scholarship? There are so already so many variations of summer programs at Cal, including summer minors, that involves different pricing and scholarship giving, and I guess it is not that hard to do something similar to 197? Why cant the university cut the tuition by 300 for us, while it is paying a head coach 3000000 per year?

Ultimately I guess it is because we international students do not have a collective voice. Admittedly, some of us do not care about the $800 because of various reasons (they can afford it; they are paid in the internship anyways; etc.), but I believe there are many of us do care. The international students already paid quadruple in normal semester, and another $800 on summer means A LOT for some of us. My parents are going all out to support my study here by living by a painfully low standard, and $800 means 4 months of food for both of them. I am also trying to minimize expense of living here. For me, $800 means one month of rent or 2 months of food.

If anyone wants to organize or petition anything, count me in.</md>

history.content:
I'm doing a summer internship as an international student, so I have to enroll CS197, which costs me $800.

This school is STEALING MONEY FROM ME! It's RIDICULOUS! I want to know if the university staff could waive the fee. I'm coming from a low-incoming household. This extra cost makes me overwhelmingly more stressful.

I'm also wondering if all international students could make petition to make it happen. My parents are living on their minimal wages to live their after-retirement life, while I'm working hard towards my degree and gets robbed money by school.
history.subject: University STEALS ME MONEY! CPT CS197 Tuition?
